content: cozy winter sweater wreath this pattern is knitted flat and then sewn around a styrofoam wreath mine was 18 in diameter and 2 1/8 thick you could easily adjust the pattern to fit your foam or even sew and stuff it with polyfill supplies ● super bulky yarn i used about 110 yards of yarn bee cozy occasion ● knitting needles size 8mm and 9mm ● cable needles i just used my 9mm needles ● 18 styrofoam wreath ● saftey pins about 50 ● tapestry needle tip to ensure that my sides matched up when i sewed it together i placed a safety pin through the first and last stitches of each 8th round then joined the matching pins together before sewing abbreviations k knit p purl ca cable a cb cable b cable section noted in pattern by cable a slip 3 stitches knit wise onto cable needle hold in front slip 1 stitch purl wise onto cable needle hold in back k3 from left working needle p1 from cable needle k3 from cable needle cable b slip 3 stitches knit wise and 1 stitch purl wise onto cable needle hold in back k3 from left working needle p1 from cable needle k3 from cable needle cast on 20 stitches with 9mm needles then switch to 8mm needles i kept my 9mm needles and used them for my cable needles 1 k4 p1 ca p1 k3 p1 k3 2 p3 k1 p3 k1 p3 k1 p3 k1 p4 3 k4 p1 k3 p1 k3 p1 k3 p1 k3 4 p3 k1 p3 k1 p3 k1 p3 k1 p4 5 k4 p1 k3 p1 cb p1 k3 6 p3 k1 p3 k1 p3 k1 p3 k1 p4 7 k4 p1 k3 p1 k3 p1 k3 p1 k3 8 p3 k1 p3 k1 p3 k1 p3 k1 p4 8 opt place safety pin in the first and last stitch to aid in sewing later repeat 20 more times or untill your piece is long enough to go around your wreath cast off then sew cast on and cast off sides together join safety pins together around your wreath starting at your cast off end to ensure that they all match up then sew together
